pageContext.claim: “Instead of taking up to 20 years to approve a major project, we're cutting the federal permitting timeline -- it's already been done -- to a maximum of two years or less; in some cases, even less than one year.”
pageContext.analysis: This is a wide exaggeration. According to our friends at Politifact, recent government studies say the permit approval time ranges from 4.6 to 6.6 years. The only study that claims a 10-year approval is common comes from a pro-deregulation group, which raises questions about its reliability. This still falls short of Trump's 21 year claim.
